cipher2_jp4100 package¶

Submodules¶

cipher2_jp4100.cipher2_jp4100 module¶

cipher2_jp4100.cipher2_jp4100.cipher(text, shift, encrypt=True)[source]¶

This is a function to encipher or decipher code and is called caesar cipher.

Parameters

  • text (str) – A string that you want to encrypt or decrypt.

  • shift (int) – An integer which infers positions you want to change the text from the original format. It can be both positive and negative. Positive shift means shift forward, while negative one means shift backward.

  • encrypt (bool) – A boolean value which will encipher the text if it is True, otherwise, it will decipher the text. The default value is True.

Returns

The new text after enciphering or deciphering.

Return type

str

Examples

>>> from cipher_jp4100 import cipher_jp4100
>>> cipher_jp4100.cipher(text='abc', shift=3, encrypt=True)
'def'
>>> cipher_jp4100.cipher(text='abc', shift=3, encrypt=False)
'XYZ'
